title: Washington Post layoffs disproportionately affected union members of color, preliminary Guild data shows
description: When The Washington Post laid off more than a third of its employees on February 4, the paper’s foundation was shaken. The cuts were wide-ranging, shuttering the sports desk right before the Winter Olympics and letting go of foreign correspondents covering active wars. Data released Friday by The Washington Post Guild shows that layoffs fell...
